Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:

  • 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon flour
  • 1 cup beef broth
  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
  • 1/2 cup sour cream
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley, chopped (optional)

Directions:

  1. In a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat.
  2. Add the beef and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
  3. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
  4. Add the onion and mushrooms to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
  5. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
  6. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir to combine.
  7. Add the beef broth, Dijon mustard, and Worcestershire sauce and stir to combine.
  8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
  9. Stir in the sour cream and cooked beef and cook until heated through, about 2-3 minutes.
  10. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with fresh parsley if desired.
